intro: Hieracium grossianum subsp. grossianum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cold, high-altitude environments. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk and is often found in open, sunny areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
